That’s

it!

Yes, it’s rank!

To survive in nature, all life belongs to an *ecological hierarchy.

One grows on the top branches of the trees and is soft and sweet-tasting. The other fruit is on the ground, has a hard shell, and is tough to eat.

Let’s suppose

a species of monkey living in a forest.

There are two types of fruit in the forest.

*Ecological hierarchy: The theory that two species of the same rank cannot coexist.
